text:
NAEB RADIO NETWORK
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
To: ALL NETWORK MEMBERS
Prom: NETWORK MANAGER
Re: SUPPLEMENT #6 TO 1ST QUARTER, 1957 OFFERING
CORRECTION: On Page 2 of the 5th supplement to the current offering we gave the
corrected list of titles for the series FIRST IMPRESSIONS OF FAR AWAY PLACES (57-12)•
Unfortunately, these programs were credited to the series CURTAIN GOING UP (56-36).
We are sorry about this error and hope it caused you no inconvenience*
Georgetown Radio Forum (56-51)
Program 20 - Issue 7
Topic: THE GREATNESS OF LINCOLN
Panelists: Dr. David C. learns, Head, Manuscript Division, The Library of Congress:
author of nThe Lincoln Papers;"
Rev. Joseph T. Durkin, S.J., Professor of Constitutional History, George¬
town University.
Program 21 - Issue 8
Topic: JEFFERSON AND HAMILTON
Panelists: Mr. Irving Brant, biographer of James Madison and expert on the founding
fathers of America;
Dr. Frank L. Monaghan, historian of the 18th century;
Dr. Walter R. Welsh, Department of History, instructor in Early American
History, Georgetown University, and author of an upcoming article on
Thomas Jefferson in the South Carolina Historical Magazine.
Program 22 - Issue 9
Topic: LIVING COSTS: OUT OF CONTROL?
Panelists: Dr. John Kenneth Galbraith, Professor of Economics, Harvard University;
author of "American Capitalism," "Theory of Price Control," "The Great
Crash, 1929;" former Director of the Office of Economic Security Policy;
Mr. George Bookman, member, Washington Bureau, Time, Inc.;
Mr. Joseph R. Slevin, Washington correspondent on economic affairs. New
York Herald Tribune.
a#**#**####**
